alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Winter Storm Has Ended And Cold Is On The Way... The series of winter storms that impacted the Eastern Interior of Alaska since Christmas have now ended. Fairbanks received over 23 inches of snow since Christmas, with over 3 tenths of an inch of ice accumulation, along with significant sleet and rain. These storms have now moved east, and only an inch of additional snow accumulation is expected this morning. Much colder air will be moving over Interior Alaska over the next several days, with temperatures falling into the 30s below over the weekend. Residents needing to clear snow and ice may want to take advantage of the warmer temperatures today and Friday.
